ovdesc.p: When a non fatal error is reported in the batch it is possible to save certain records which may be of use in tracking down the cause of the problem.
The records which are saved when a non fatal error is reported in the batch are saved to this file. Each saved record has a record on this file, the keys to which are held on the EB.EOD.ERROR file.
This is a live file and hence input is not allowed.

desc.p: When a mismatch occurs between the CRB and the position files during the end of day revaluation processing a record is created on this file which uses the fields RE.CCY.MKT to RE.CRF.AMT, which form a related multi value set.
This field holds the amount with which the position files have been updated.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.
The description of the record held in the ADDITIONAL field is held in this field.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.

When a mismatch occurs between the CRB and the position files during the end of day revaluation processing a record is created on this file which uses the fields RE.CCY.MKT to RE.CRF.AMT, which form a related multi value set.
This field holds the currency market in which the mismatch has occurred.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.
The error code used in the call to the EXCEPTION.LOG.FILE is held in this field.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.
The name of the module from which the error originated is held in this field.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.

When a mismatch occurs between the CRB and the position files during the end of day revaluation processing a record is created on this file which uses the fields RE.CCY.MKT to RE.CRF.AMT, which form a related multi value set.
This field details the position type in which the mismatch occurred.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.
Standard T24 date field.
A maximum of 11 characters may be entered.
The name of the routine from which the error originated is held in this field.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.

When a mismatch occurs between the CRB and the position files during the end of day revaluation processing a record is created on this file which uses the fields RE.CCY.MKT to RE.CRF.AMT, which form a related multi value set.
This fields holds the amount with which the CRB has been updated.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.

This field is used to actually hold the record. Each field is represented by a multi value and each multivalue is represented by a sub value. Sub value fields are included on the same line as their related multi values.
This is a system maintained field. This is a NOINPUT field.
The application identifier from which the error originated is held in this field.
This is a system maintained field. This is a NOINPUT field.
The machine date and time at which the error occurred.
This is a system maintained field. This is a NOINPUT field.
A unique key by which the Entry may be identified. It is generated by the system, based on the date and time (in hundredths of a second) at which the record was generated and a sequence number.
The key is made up as follows:
(a) 4 digit date expressed as the number of days since 31st December 1967.
(b) Time in seconds since midnight, consisting of 5 integers and (usually) 2 decimals. If the time is an exact number of seconds since midnight, the decimals are omitted.
(c) Sequence number.
If several records are generated at the same time, all the Entries have parts (a) and (b) the same and are distinguished from each other by their Sequence numbers.
13 numeric characters or 16 characters consisting of 15 numeric characters with a decimal point after the 9th.
Internal file. This is a NOINPUT field.

When a mismatch occurs between the CRB and the position files during the end of day revaluation processing a record is created on this file which uses the fields RE.CCY.MKT to RE.CRF.AMT, which form a related multi value set.
This field details the currency in which the mismatch occurred.
This is a system maintained, NOINPUT field.
